intro: Chiococca densifolia var. cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban chiococca, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dense foliage and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
